intro: Hieracium melanops subsp. melanops, commonly known as the black hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typical sunflower-like appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with dark green, hairy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Its subspecies is distinguished by its dark purple or blackish flowers and robust growth habit.
